DESC.PARA: The unsubtract command undoes the background subtraction to restore the input source dataset amplitudes.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to unsubtract; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")

DESC.PARA: The "subtracted" field of the source dataset is updated to indicate that the data are not background-subtracted, as shown in the examples.

To background-subtract a dataset, use the subtract command
("ahelp subtract").
Undo the background subtraction of the default dataset.
Undo the background subtraction of the dataset "src". The "subtracted" field of the source data object is updated to show that the dataset is not background-subtracted.
